free_txt: BP
Original report and erratum.
Corrections to the cross section for the effect of
thick target and inhomogeneity of the beam.
Erratum: Experiments on the reaction 20(30,240)n [1-H-
2(HE3,P)2-HE-4] have shown a mistake in the design
of the ionization chamber used in the 230 [HE3]
experiments. Corrections can be made to the results
already obtained by calculating the fraction of the
240's [2-HE-4] emitted which reached the detecting
region with sufficient energy (about 330 keV by
experiment) to be detected. In other words, the the
solid angle in which particles were detected was not
determined entirely by the collimating system but also
by the variation of the range of the emitted particles
with angle and bombarding energy. A crude estimate of
the necessary correction factor to the data reported is
1.02 for an average energy of 0.9 MeV, increasing to
1.47 at 0.475 MeV. In making these estimates it was
assumed that the energy loss in the collection region
necessary for a particle to be detected was 0.8 MeV
which has turned out to be too high, in view of some
recent experiments. No recalculation is being made at
this time, however, since the entire problem requires
careful and detailed examination.
Probable error. Each quantity involved in
the calculations was critically examined and an
estimate of the error in that quantity made. The
uncertainty of a given quantity is the maximum amount
or fraction of that quantity by which it is believed
the measured value could have differed from the true
value. If the reasonable view were taken that the
uncertainties connected with sigma independent of
each other, then their sum should be the square root
of the sum of their squares. This gives a total
root-mean-square uncertainty of 11.7% in the value of
any one measurement of the absolute cross section.
He3 beam.
The above cross section values were obtained from
measurements in a cone of approximately 45 degrees
about the direction of the beam. Additional
measurements at right angles to the beam indicate
that anisotropy exists in the center of mass system.
Deuterium gas. Target was about 0.55 MeV thick.
page 1.
Data are considered by authors as erroneous.
